body_html:
It's good the configure command succeed.

The build failure is because you are not using MSVC toolchain.
Try
bazel build -c opt --cpu=x64_windows_msvc --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc --copt="/w" --experimental_ui --verbose_failures tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
Or make sure your ~/.bazelrc is:

build -c opt
build --cpu=x64_windows_msvc
build --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc
build --copt="/w"                  # Suppress some warning messages
build --experimental_ui            # Enable a nice UI
build --verbose_failures

The build failure is because you are not using MSVC toolchain.
Try
bazel build -c opt  --cpu=x64_windows_msvc --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc --copt="/w" --experimental_ui --verbose_failures tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
Or make sure your ~/.bazelrc is:
build -c opt
build --cpu=x64_windows_msvc
build --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc
build --copt="/w"                  # Suppress some warning messages
build --experimental_ui            # Enable a nice UI
build --verbose_failures
body:
It's good the configure command succeed.

The build failure is because you are not using MSVC toolchain.
Try
`bazel build -c opt  --cpu=x64_windows_msvc --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc --copt="/w" --experimental_ui --verbose_failures tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package`
Or make sure your `~/.bazelrc` is:
```
build -c opt
build --cpu=x64_windows_msvc
build --host_cpu=x64_windows_msvc
build --copt="/w"                  # Suppress some warning messages
build --experimental_ui            # Enable a nice UI
build --verbose_failures

```
